meanings.definition: In a way that provokes laughter or amusement.
meanings.sent1: The comedian's jokes were so risibly funny that the audience couldn't stop laughing.
meanings.sent2: She told the story so risibly that everyone in the room chuckled.
meanings.sent3: The cat's attempt to chase its tail was risibly entertaining.
meanings.sent4: The clown's oversized shoes made his walk risibly comical.
meanings.sent5: The children found the puppet show risibly delightful.

meanings.sent1: The silly hat was so risibly large that it covered his entire head.
meanings.sent2: The awkward dance moves were risibly amusing to the onlookers.
meanings.sent3: The dog's attempt to wear sunglasses was risibly adorable.
meanings.sent4: The old car's sputtering engine was risibly unreliable.
meanings.sent5: The magician's failed trick was risibly embarrassing.
